sigma.description: This parameter gives coefficient of relative risk aversion/intertemporal elasticity of substitution

frisch.long_name: Frisch elastictiy of labor supply used to fit elliptical utility
frisch.description: The Frisch elasticity gives the elasticity of labor supply to changes in the net of tax wage rate, holding wealth constant.   This means that the Frisch elasticity captures the substitution effects, but not the income effects, of a change in the net of tax wage rate.  A Frisch elasticity of 0.4 would indicate that if the net of tax wage rate increases by 10% then hours worked would increase by 4%, if wealth were held constant.  Note that OG-USA uses an elliptical utility function for labor supply.  We parameterize this function to fit a constant Frisch elasticity function with a Frisch elasticity as input here.
